Transferred_Post:
"Ugh, I'm so sunburnt! 🌞😓 I was waiting for my mum to come home, so I decided to take a nap on the trampoline. 🤦‍♀️ Next thing I knew, I had been sleeping for 2 hours in the scorching sun! 😱 My poor skin is now lobster red and sizzling hot! 🍽️🔥 #SunburnSOS #TrampolineTragedy #NapGoneWrong"

Explanation:

The original post attributes the cause of the sunburn to the individual's own actions (taking a nap on the trampoline) and external factors (the scorching sun). To convert it to an external attributional style, we can attribute the cause of the sunburn to external factors such as the weather or environment.

Transferred Post: "Ugh, I'm so sunburnt! 🌞😓 I was waiting for my mum to come home, so I decided to take a nap on the trampoline. 🤦‍♀️ Next thing I knew, I had been sleeping for 2 hours in the scorching sun! 😱 My poor skin is now lobster red and sizzling hot! 🍽️🔥 #SunburnSOS #TrampolineTragedy #NapGoneWrong"

Explanation:

In this transferred post, the cause of the sunburn is attributed to external factors such as the weather (the scorching sun) and the environment (the trampoline). The individual's own actions are not mentioned as a cause of the sunburn. This External attributional style focuses on the external factors that led to the sunburn, rather than the individual's own actions or characteristics.
